title: possible to accomodate alternate doc-comment style?

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body: hi folks! I was wondering whether it would be agreeable to support a certain edge case formatting for doc comments as follows: In the codebases I write, I like to do this: Specifically, I am referring to the left margin vertical pipe. /** | doc comment body | | */ I do this because I think it is a bit easier to read, and because, to me, it looks better in my editor. I find that the left margin pipe character `|` lets my eyes lock in on doc comments more easily when I encounter them in the code. Anyway, most of my codebases look like this. I like to be able to use this particular formatting when I write code. I am reluctant to change these usages, though I find they complicate the automatic documentation generated into docs.rs. What happens on docs.rs is that, without a special case, these pipe characters get interspersed with the actual documentation. I am wondering if, for example, it would be reasonable/agreeable for me/us to *special case* the formatting code which is involved in generating the documentation. What I am considering is that we can *check* whether the doc comment has this particular left margin all the way down. If so, during the doc comment generation, we can *remove* the whole left margin pipe, leaving just the interior documentation comment as desired. I think it should probably not be too much of an issue, or cause any undesired behavior elsewhere. What do you think? Is this straightforward? Would you accept a pull request for this, if I could figure out how to do it? Is there anything else I should consider? Perhaps, once implemented, there could be a way to activate this feature explicitly, so that it is not the default behavior.
